meanings.definition: To become very scared or frightened.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm freaked the little girl.
meanings.sent2: She freaked out when she saw a spider on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie really freaked her out, but she still wanted to watch more.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected noise freaked her like a ghost in the night.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house tour was designed to freak visitors out at every turn.

meanings.definition: To behave or react in a wild or irrational manner.
meanings.sent1: During the game, he freaked out and started yelling at the referee.
meanings.sent2: The toddler freaked when he couldn't find his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The cat freaked out and knocked over the vase while chasing a fly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind freaked like a computer glitch, unable to process the unexpected news.
meanings.sent5: The party was so fun that everyone freaked out and danced wildly.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel scared or shocked.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie freaked her friend so much that he couldn't sleep.
meanings.sent2: The sudden appearance of the ghost in the play freaked the audience.
meanings.sent3: The prank really freaked him, but he couldn't help but laugh afterwards.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news freaked her like a bolt of lightning on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house decorations were so realistic that they freaked out many visitors.
